intro: Caustis blakei subsp. macrantha, commonly known as the Natal flatleaf, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its broad, flat leaves that often form a dense rosette. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested or rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
